title: His wife was killed the day before their eviction. A decade later, he faced another foreclosure — and a murder charge.
description: When Nick Firkus’ second wife discovered he was hiding their upcoming foreclosure, his first wife’s death around the time of their eviction began to make sense.

title: 4 charged in illegal sale of dinosaur bones  that were shipped to China
description: A U.S. grand jury in Utah returned a 13-count indictment charging 4 people with buying and selling more than $1 million in “paleontological resources,” which includes dinosaur bones that were exported to China, authorities announced Thursday.

title: Federal agents found more than two dozen minors working in Ohio poultry plant
description: Federal agents found more than two dozen minors illegally working inside a poultry plant in Kidron, Ohio, earlier this month, say local immigration advocates.

title: Iran is not currently seeking direct war with United States, U.S. officials say
description: The U.S. intelligence community believes Iran is not currently seeking a direct war with the U.S. but is looking to ratchet up pressure on Israel and the U.S.

title: Spirit Airlines says it's canceling some flights so it can inspect planes
description: Spirit Airlines, flight cancelations, Spirit cancels flights

title: An artist and a recent H.S. grad: These are the two American hostages released by Hamas
description: Judith Raanan and daughter Natalie were staying with relatives in Israel when they were taken by Hamas militants storming kibbutz Nahal Oz on October 7.

title: Judge lets Trump co-defendant keep his attorney in classified docs case despite possible conflicts of interest
description: Walt Nauta’s defense attorney, Stanley Woodward, had previously represented a key witness that the government intends to call at trial.

title: The United States ranks 118th in the world for racial inclusion according to annual tally
description: The U.S. continues to underperform on an annual list that ranks inclusivity as experienced by marginalized groups in countries across the globe.

title: Supreme Court blocks restrictions on Biden administration efforts to remove contentious social media posts
description: The Supreme Court addresses curbs on Biden administration contacts with social media companies on Covid-19, the 2020 election and other problematic Content.

title: Prosecutors in Sam Bankman-Fried trial compare defense argument to ‘Dumb and Dumber’
description: Prosecutors in the criminal trial against FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried compared one of the defense’s arguments to a scene in the 1994 film “Dumb and Dumber,” in which actor Jim Carrey says IOUs are “as good as money.”

title: Former U.S. firearms investigator illegally trafficked guns to Mexico, government document alleges
description: Former ATF investigator Jose Luis Meneses admitted to buying firearm parts and trafficking them into Mexico, according to a letter to ATF by U.S. Senator Charles Grassley.

title: In search of 10 billion missing snow crabs, scientists eye marine heat waves
description: About 10 billion snow crabs disappeared from Bering Sea waters between 2018 and 2021, forcing to shutter fisheries in Alaska last winter and threatening the state’s economy.

title: YouTube demonitizes prominent creator Sssniperwolf’s channel following accusations of doxxing fellow creator
description: YouTube on Friday said it was issuing a temporary monetization suspension to creator Alia Shelesh, known as SSSniperwolf on the platform, after allegations that she doxxed fellow creator Jack Douglass.

title: University of Michigan pledges cooperation with NCAA over probe into sign-stealing allegations
description: University of Michigan’ undefeated football team is being investigated by the NCAA over sign-stealing allegations. Coach Jim Harbaugh denied knowledge of such actions.

title: Why co-washing can be a game changer for curly and coily hair
description: Co-washes combine the benefits of shampoo and conditioners together. Shop the best ones from brands like Oribe, Ouidad, Christophe Robin and more.

title: Supreme Court rejects Missouri bid to implement law that limits state role in enforcing federal gun laws
description: The case reflects clashing interpretations of the right to bear arms under the Constitution’s 2nd Amendment.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy wants the U.S. to have an Iron Dome. It's not so simple.
description: Vivek Ramaswamy said during a question-and-answer session Wednesday that he'd like the U.S. to mimic Israel's short-range missile defenses.

title: White House gives statement on release of two Americans held hostage by Hamas
description: NBC News' Gabe Gutierrez reports on a statement from the Biden administration after the release of two Americans held hostage by Hamas.

title: Tennessee convict on the run after escaping from police transport van
description: A convict facing numerous sexual assault of minors and drug charges is currently on the run in Tennessee after he escaped by kicking out the back window of a transport van, authorities said.

title: Michigan nursing student killed by ex-boyfriend who called his parents to confess before killing himself, police say
description: A 25-year-old nursing student was killed by her ex-boyfriend who allegedly called his parents to confess before killing himself, authorities in Michigan said.

title: Hamas statement on hostage release cites 'humanitarian reasons'
description: Two American hostages have been released by Hamas, according to 3 people with knowledge of the matter. Hamas claimed they were releasing the American mother and daughter for "humanitarian reasons" and as a rebuke to Pres. Biden's condemnation of the group.

title: London police offer new reward in cold case of body discovered in wine bar freezer after 9 years
description: Police in London sought help from the public on Friday to identify the person responsible for a man’s death whose body was found inside a freezer at an empty pub after he had been missing for nearly a decade.

title: A new crop of GOP Senate candidates grapples with Trump-skeptical pasts
description: Republican Senate candidates are still struggling to reconcile their political brands with Donald Trump — and explain away past criticism of him.

title: America's only Formula One driver is fighting for his future. He says he knows 'exactly' what he needs to do.
description: AUSTIN — Logan Sargeant is the only American driver in Formula One.

description: During Leah Aden’s first oral arguments before the U.S.

title: Former Florida lawmaker who sponsored 'Don't Say Gay' sentenced to prison for Covid-19 relief fraud
description: The former Florida lawmaker who sponsored the controversial law critics call “Don’t Say Gay” was sentenced to six months in federal prison.

title: Georgia agrees to pay for gender-affirming care for public employees, settling a lawsuit
description: Georgia will start paying for gender-affirming care for state employees, public school teachers and former employees covered by a state health insurance plan.

title: Massive protests seen at U.S. embassies in several countries after Gaza hospital bombing
description: Thousands of people in Muslim countries and beyond held demonstrations Friday in solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, calling for an end to Israel’s blockade and airstrikes in the wake of a brutal incursion into southern Israel by fighters from the Hamas militant group that rules Gaza.

title: Trump co-defendant Kenneth Chesebro strikes plea deal with Georgia prosecutors
description: Trump campaign legal adviser Kenneth Chesebro struck a deal with prosecutors from the Fulton County, Georgia, district attorney’s office in its 2020 election interference case on Friday.

title: Israeli family fears child may spend his 9th birthday as a hostage of Hamas
description: The family of Ohad Munder-Zichri fear he has been taken hostage by Hamas and will spend his birthday in the hands of the militant group.

title: How Ron DeSantis' super PAC is taking financial pressure off his campaign
description: Recent campaign finance reports illustrate how Ron DeSantis' super PAC has helped cover costs that otherwise might have drained his own campaign treasury.

title: White House seeks more aid for Israel and Ukraine in $105B funding request
description: The White House on Friday requested that Congress provide more than $105 billion in aid to Ukraine and Israel and other national security needs.

title: St. Louis football coach shot by parent during practice allegedly over non-starting position
description: A youth football team’s season was canceled after the coach was shot multiple times allegedly by an angry parent who was upset his son was not a starting player, court documents state.

title: SAG-AFTRA issues new guidelines for 'strike-friendly' Halloween costumes
description: SAG-AFTRA told members to avoid wearing Halloween costumes that depict a television or film character. The organization said to stick to generalized character costumes.

title: NYU law school journal discriminates against straight, white applicants, lawsuit alleges
description: A conservative legal group sued New York University on Thursday in federal court, claiming NYU School of Law’s process in selecting students to work on its flagship academic publication gives preference to women and minorities in violation of U.S. law.

title: Marlon Wayans says he is being unfairly prosecuted after being racially targeted by gate agent
description: Actor and comedian Marlon Wayans says he is being unfairly prosecuted for disturbing the peace over a dispute with an airline employee who he alleges targeted him because of his race.

title: Judge blocks California school district policy to notify parents if their child changes pronouns
description: Parts of a California school district policy that require staff to tell parents if their child asks to change their gender identification will remain halted.

title: Maryland circuit court judge killed in driveway of home, police say
description: A Maryland judge was found apparently shot in the driveway of his home Thursday evening and later died, officials say.

description: Israel-Hamas war, Jim Jordan, Patrick McHenry, Pepperdine University, Natalee Holloway, Indiana serial killer, Travis King, Britney Spears

title: China is building up its nuclear arsenal faster than predicted, U.S. report says
description: A Pentagon report on China’s military power says Beijing is exceeding previous projections of how quickly it is building up its nuclear weapons arsenal.

title: Muslim members of Congress face spikes in death threats
description: Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., said she worries for her children’s safety as her office is inundated with profanity-laced threats.

title: Electric scooters, curling irons, desk magnets: Pediatricians warn products are injuring kids
description: Electric scooters, hair styling tools and tiny magnets found in desk toys are landing kids in the emergency room, according to a spate of new research.

title: Britney Spears reflects on her 'traumatizing' conservatorship in upcoming memoir
description: In her upcoming memoir, Britney Spears is shedding new light onto what her life was like during her 13-year court-ordered conservatorship.

title: Inside the White House's outreach to the family of the slain 6-year-old Palestinian American boy
description: President Joe Biden mentioned Wadea Al-Fayoume in his Oval Office speech Thursday night. Immediately afterward, he called the boy's family.

title: Hunter Biden special counsel David Weiss to testify before House committee
description: Weiss will sit for a closed-door interview on Nov. 7 with the House Judiciary Committee led by GOP chairman Jim Jordan of Ohio.

title: How Biden’s support for Israel could be received by Arab leaders
description: NBC's Kier Simmons reports on how President Joe Biden’s show of support for Israel could be received by Arab leaders.

title: Biden reflects on why conflicts in Israel, Ukraine should matter to Americans
description: President Joe Biden announced that he is going to send an urgent security package request to Congress to help fund defense in Israel and Ukraine and why ending those conflicts should matter to people in the U.S.
